channel.title: Author on SCL Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Author on SCL Blog

item.title: Maave
item.author: team@silocitylabs.com (Silo City Labs)
item.description: About Make stuff, break stuff. Follow the development of my open source gamepad for phones here on the blog or on Hackaday.io See more projects here

item.title: Andrew Elbaneh
item.author: team@silocitylabs.com (Silo City Labs)
item.description: About I am a software developer with a primary focus on web development, although my expertise extends to various other programming languages. I am driven by a passion for learning and am always eager to adopt new technologies to enhance my craft and career. I am the founder of One Buffalo Labs, a company specializing in web development and AI solutions. I also manage my own gaming projects under Silo City Games and One Buffalo Games.

item.title: Don Ko
item.author: team@silocitylabs.com (Silo City Labs)
item.description: About Projects About Co-founder and Chief Marketing Officer at PlantCare, boasts over 15 years of experience in product management and marketing for high-tech products. Hailing from Buffalo, NY, Don’s passion for home automation began nearly a decade ago with connected lightbulbs and has since evolved into a fascination with smart home devices. This interest has seamlessly translated into his role at PlantCare, where he is thrilled to be part of extending smart technology to the garden.

item.title: Luis Rodriguez
item.author: team@silocitylabs.com (Silo City Labs)
item.description: About Resume Skills & Certifications Projects Articles About Luis Rodriguez is a dedicated engineer and technology enthusiast with a passion for solving problems and creating innovative solutions. With a strong foundation in software development and electronics, he has spent years turning complex ideas into practical, user-friendly systems. As a key contributor to SiloCityLabs—a collaborative group of like-minded technologists—Luis enjoys working with others to explore and develop creative solutions to challenging problems.
